sen.j: 伊集院 兼寛（いじゅういん かねひろ、天保9年1月2日（1838年1月27日） - 明治31年（1898年）4月20日）は、日本の武士・薩摩藩士､軍人､官僚である。
sen.e: Kanehiro IJUIN (January 27, 1838-April 20, 1898) was a samurai, a retainer of the Satsuma Domain, a military officer, and a government official.
Kanehiro IJUIN (January 27, 1838 - April 20, 1898) was a samurai, a feudal retainer of the Satsuma clan, a military officer, and a government official in Japan.
sen.cmt: スペースを修正しました。「薩摩藩士」を修正しました。「日本の」を補いました。
sen.e: Kanehiro IJUIN (January 27, 1838 - April 20, 1898) was a samurai, a feudal retainer of the Satsuma clan, a military officer, and a government official in Japan.

sen.j: 薩摩藩出身。
sen.e: He came from the Satsuma Domain.
He came from the Satsuma Domain.
He came from the Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 通称は直右衛門。
sen.e: He was commonly known as 'Naoemon.'
He was commonly known as Naoemon.
sen.cmt: クォーツを削除しました。
sen.e: He was commonly known as Naoemon.

sen.j: 諱は兼寛。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Kanehiro.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ対応しました。なお、ここでの「兼寛」の読みは確認出来ておりません。
sen.e: His posthumous name was Kanehiro.

sen.j: 明治期に海軍少輔・元老院議官・貴族院議員を歴任。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, he worked as the Junior Assistant Minister of the Navy, a councilor of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders), and a member of the House of Peers.
In the Meiji period, he worked as the Junior Assistant Minister of the Navy, a councilor of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders), and a member of the House of Peers.
In the Meiji period, he worked as the Junior Assistant Minister of the Navy, a councilor of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders), and a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 子爵。
sen.e: He was created Viscount.
He was a Viscount.
He was a Viscount.

sen.j: 実姉の伊集院須賀が嘉永5年（1852年）に西郷隆盛に嫁いでいる。
sen.e: Suga IJUIN, his older sister, married to Takamori SAIGO in 1852.
Suga IJUIN, his older sister, married Takamori SAIGO in 1852.
sen.cmt: married to→married と修正しました。
sen.e: Suga IJUIN, his older sister, married Takamori SAIGO in 1852.

sen.j: 〔安政元年（1854年）に離婚〕
sen.e: She got divorced in 1854.
She divorced him in 1854.
sen.cmt: got divorced→divorced him と修正しました。
sen.e: She divorced him in 1854.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 幕末維新期
sen.e: The Restoration period at the end of the Edo period
The Restoration period at the end of the Edo period
The Restoration period at the end of the Edo period

sen.j: 伊集院兼寛は天保9年（1838年）薩摩藩士伊集院兼善の嫡男として生まれる。
sen.e: Kanehiro IJUIN was born the legitimate son of Kaneyoshi IJUIN, a retainer of the Satsuma Domain.
Kanehiro IJUIN was born in 1838, as the legitimate son of Kaneyoshi IJUIN, a feudal retainer of the Satsuma clan.
sen.cmt: 「1838年」を補いました。as を補いました。retainer of the Satsuma Domain→feudal retainer of the Satsuma clan と修正しました。
sen.e: Kanehiro IJUIN was born in 1838, as the legitimate son of Kaneyoshi IJUIN, a feudal retainer of the Satsuma clan.

sen.j: 幕末維新期の兼寛は西郷隆盛・西郷従道兄弟や大久保利通らとの関係が深く薩摩藩きっての行動派の一人として活躍する。
sen.e: During the Restoration period at the end of the Edo period, he had a bond of relationship with SAIGO brother (Takamori SAIGO and Tsugumichi SAIGO) and Toshimichi OKUBO and came to the fore as one of the most active warriors in the Satsuma Domain.

During the Restoration period at the end of the Edo period, he had a strong relationship with Saigo brothers (Takamori SAIGO and Tsugumichi SAIGO) and Toshimichi OKUBO, and came to the fore as one of the most active warriors in the Satsuma Domain.
sen.cmt: bond of→strong,SAIGO brother→Saigo brothers と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: During the Restoration period at the end of the Edo period, he had a strong relationship with Saigo brothers (Takamori SAIGO and Tsugumichi SAIGO) and Toshimichi OKUBO, and came to the fore as one of the most active warriors in the Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）の寺田屋騒動に有馬新七の同志として討幕計画に参加するも藩主命令により帰順する。
sen.e: He got involved in a conspiracy to overthrow the bakufu (government led by shogun) as a comrade of Shinshichi ARIMA in the Teradaya Commotion in 1862 but returned to allegiance upon the decree of the lord of the domain.

He was involved in a conspiracy to overthrow the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), as a comrade of Shinshichi ARIMA in the Teradaya Commotion in 1862, but returned to allegiance upon the decree of the lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: got→was,「幕府」のカッコ部分を修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: He was involved in a conspiracy to overthrow the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), as a comrade of Shinshichi ARIMA in the Teradaya Commotion in 1862, but returned to allegiance upon the decree of the lord of the domain.

sen.j: 謹慎処分を受ける。
sen.e: He was instructed to stay at home to show penitence.
He received a penitence.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じてスムースに修正しました。
sen.e: He received a penitence.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）の蛤御門の変では斥候として参加。
sen.e: He joined the 1863 Conspiracy of Hamaguri-gomon Gate as a patrol.
He joined the Conspiracy of Hamaguri-gomon Gate as a scout in 1863.
sen.cmt: 1863→in 1863 として移動しました。patrol→scout と修正しました。（「斥候＝偵察のための部隊、あるいはその行為」として）
sen.e: He joined the Conspiracy of Hamaguri-gomon Gate as a scout in 1863.

sen.j: 藩主より功賜金を賜る。
sen.e: He was gifted a reward by the lord of the domain.
He was granted a monetary reward by the lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: gifted→granted と修正しました。reward→monetary reward と修正しました。
sen.e: He was granted a monetary reward by the lord of the domain.

sen.j: 同年の薩英戦争では決死隊の一員に加わる。
sen.e: In the Anglo-Satsuma War of the same year, he joined the Do-or-Die Squad.
In the Anglo-Satsuma War of the same year, he joined the do-or-die squad.
sen.cmt: Do-or-Die Squad→do-or-die squad と修正しました。
sen.e: In the Anglo-Satsuma War of the same year, he joined the do-or-die squad.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では東山道総督府参謀に任ぜられ各地を転戦する。
sen.e: In the Boshin War, he was assigned to an officer in charge of strategies at Tosando Sotokufu (the Tosando Viceroy Headquarters), and he fought battles at various places.
In the Boshin War, he was assigned to an officer in charge of strategies at Tosando Sotokufu (the Tosando Viceroy Headquarters), and he fought battles at various places.
In the Boshin War, he was assigned to an officer in charge of strategies at Tosando Sotokufu (the Tosando Viceroy Headquarters), and he fought battles at various places.

sen.j: 明治以降
sen.e: After the Meiji period
After the Meiji period
After the Meiji period

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）大蔵省に出仕。
sen.e: In 1871, he entered the Ministry of Finance.
In 1871, he entered the Ministry of Finance.
In 1871, he entered the Ministry of Finance.

sen.j: 明治初期の会計制度の整備に尽力。
sen.e: He strived to develop the accounting system in the early Meiji period.
He strove to develop the accounting system in the early Meiji period.
He strove to develop the accounting system in the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 同6年（1873年）海軍省に入省。
sen.e: In 1873, he joined the Ministry of the Navy.
In 1873, he joined the Ministry of the Navy.
In 1873, he joined the Ministry of the Navy.

sen.j: 翌年に海軍少輔に昇進。
sen.e: He was promoted to the Junior Assistant Minister of the Navy.
He was promoted to the Junior Assistant Minister of the Navy in the following year.
He was promoted to the Junior Assistant Minister of the Navy in the following year.

sen.j: 台湾出兵の事務処理を手がける。
sen.e: He handled administrative jobs concerning the Taiwan expedition.
He handled the administrative jobs concerning the Taiwan expedition.
He handled the administrative jobs concerning the Taiwan expedition.

sen.j: 同10年の西南戦争では四国方面の情勢探索活動に従事。
sen.e: In the Seinan War in 1877, he conducted espionage activities in the Shikoku region.
In the Seinan War in 1877, he conducted the espionage activities in the Shikoku region.
In the Seinan War in 1877, he conducted the espionage activities in the Shikoku region.

sen.j: 同11年（1878年）元老院議官に就任。
sen.e: In 1878, he was elected a councilor of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders).
In 1878, he assumed the position of a councilor of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders).
sen.cmt: was elected→assumed the position of と修正しました。
sen.e: In 1878, he assumed the position of a councilor of Genroin (the Chamber of Elders).

sen.j: 同20年（1887年）子爵を授けられ華族に列する。
sen.e: He was created viscount in 1887 and joined the peerage.
He was conferred the title of viscount in 1887 and joined the peerage.
sen.cmt: created→conferred と修正しました。the title of を補いました。
sen.e: He was conferred the title of viscount in 1887 and joined the peerage.

sen.j: 同23年（1890年）帝国議会創設により貴族院議員に就任。
sen.e: Upon the establishment of the Imperial Diet in 1890, he became a member of the House of Peers.
Upon the establishment of the Imperial Diet in 1890, he became a member of the House of Peers.
Upon the establishment of the Imperial Diet in 1890, he became a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 同30年まで務める。
sen.e: He held the post until 1897.
He held the post until 1897.
He held the post until 1897.

sen.j: 同31年（1898年）4月16日勲一等瑞宝章を授与される。
sen.e: On April 16, 1898, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
On April 16, 1898, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
On April 16, 1898, he was conferred the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Sacred Treasure.

sen.j: その4日後の4月20日死去。
sen.e: He passed away on April 20, four days after the award.
He passed away on April 20, four days after the award.
He passed away on April 20, four days after the award.
